intro: Clarkia modesta, commonly known as the modest clarkia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its showy, cup-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as meadows, grasslands, and rocky slopes, thriving in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often hairy and branching. Clarkia modesta is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its delicate appearance and long blooming period.
